page.title: 05WITLEY COURT _ FOLEY ERA
page.content: In{1655 Thomas Foley,}son of the early Stourbridge Ironmaster Richard Foley, bought Witley Court from Thomas Russell. His grandson,the first{Lord {Foley,}transformed the house between {1683}and{1733.}He added the two north wings and erected stable blocks. He was also responsible for the alterations to the church, completed in{1735}in which the site of the church was moved nearer to the Court enabling direct entry to be made from the Court. In the late {18th }century and early{19th}century the brick building was stuccoed and porticos were added to the north and south sides by the architect{John Nash.}The north portico was supported on six ionic columns and the south portico on eight.In 1837 due to family debts Witley Court with its estates was sold to Lord Ward for Â£890,000.
